intro: Conopodium bunioides var. nevadense, commonly known as the Nevada sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in meadows and along streams. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a distinct triangular cross-section characteristic of sedges. The flowering structure consists of small, clustered inflorescences that produce tiny, three-lobed seeds.
